verbs.description: uncoat (third-person singular simple present uncoats, present participle uncoating, simple past and past participle uncoated)

entries.meaning: (virology, intransitive) (of the capsid shell) to dissociate from the viral core in the host cell cytoplasm
examples: It takes only minutes, after entry into a cell, for a virus particle to uncoat.

entries.meaning: (virology, transitive) To remove the viral capsid of a virus, leading to the release of the viral genomic nucleic acid.
